data.title: Jazz Index - Jazzinstitut Darmstadt
data.text: Jazz Index – created on 1. August 2012The following bibliographical information is drawn from periodicals and books present in the archive of theJazzinstitut Darmstadt. Our extensive periodical collection comprises more than 55,000 issues of some1,050 jazz periodicals. Close to two-thirds of the collection has been indexed.Following the more recent entries are abbreviations denoting the nature of the material in the respectivearticles. These symbols are:[A] = analytical remarks[B] = extensive book review[BT] = blindfold test[C] = concert review[D] = discography[F] = feature article[I] = interview["I"] = article written by the respective musician himself[O] = obituary[R] = extensive record review[T] = transcriptionThe Jazz Index is a service of the...Jazzinstitut Darmstadt, Bessunger Strasse 88d, D-64285 Darmstadt, Germanyphone ++49 (6151) 963740, fax ++49 (6151) 963744This bibliography has been compiled and mailed by ... Jazzinstitut Darmstadt,e-mail: jazz@jazzinstitut.de, Internet: http://www.jazzinstitut.deMingus, Charles (b * b: 22.Apr.1922, Nogales/AZ; d: 5.Jan.1979, Cuernavaca/Mexico; Lexikon:Feather [1958]; Feather [1960]; Companion [1987]; New Grove [1988]; rororo [1988]; Reclam [1989];Dictionnaire [1988,1995]; MusicHound [1999]; Rough Guide [1999]; vertical file: Charles MINGUS[1998,2002,2006])***Thierry Pérémarti: Jazz au féminin. Sue Mingus, in: Jazz Hot, *, p. 31 (I)Ralph J. Gleason: Charlie Mingus. A Thinking Musician, in: Down Beat: 60 Years of Jazz, Milwaukee 1995(Hal Leonard Corp.) [book], p. 77-78 (F/I; Reprint aus DB, 1.Jun.1951)Charles Mingus: Ou va le jazz?, in: Jazz Hot, 18/69 (1952), p. 13-14 ("I")NN: Jazz Hot présente un grand contrebassiste: Charlie Mingus, in: Jazz Hot, 18/69 (1952), p. 12-13 (F)[xerox in vert.file]Charles Mingus Jr. & Duke Ellington: Ellington Fans Pursue Hallock's Scalp; 'Better Just to Forget It' SaysDuke, in: Down Beat, ca. May 1952 (F); reprint, in: Ken Vail: Duke's Diary. Part Two: The Life of DukeEllington, 1950-1974, Lanham/MD 2002 [book: Scarecrow Press], p. 38-39 (F/letter)
